intro: Lepadena leucoloma, commonly known as the white-leaved mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually white or pale green, which helps it blend with its host. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains seeds dispersed by birds.
